top_comments.comment: Here is a video prompt top 5 requiem. Most powerful music pieces. Something on organ music.

Omg when they said the first one I was happy  not only is debussy my fav composer but that the peice is actually one of his first peice that I started listening to and I also thought it was quite underrated
Oh, yay! I can play the cello part on Britten´s string "quartet"!

Some more underrated pieces (Most of them are baroque):
Yuli Konyus Violin Concerto
Vivaldi La Stravaganza
Vivaldi Violin Concertos op 11 & 12
Vivaldi’s Cello Concerto in D minor
Vivaldi Viola D’Amore Concertos
Vivaldi Concerto Grosso in C major
Graun Viola da Gamba Concerto in A minor
Graun Viola da Gamba Concerto in D major
Boieldieu Harp Concerto
Dittersdorf Harp Concerto in A major
Marais La Reveuse
Marais Pieces for Viola da Gamba
Telemann 12 Fantasies for solo violin without bass
Locatelli’s 25 Caprices
Matheis Fantasia in a minor (Alia Fantasia)
Etc
No one in my school even knows any classical music :(

comments_since_last_sample.body: Hello guys, love your shows. Since you know everyone and are on first name terms with Hilary Hahn, I wonder if you could entice Bomsori Kim onto your videos. I've just been to her Carl Nielsen violinconcerto in Copenhagen. What a magnificent performance.

Some more underrated pieces (Most of them are baroque):
Yuli Konyus Violin Concerto
Vivaldi La Stravaganza
Vivaldi Violin Concertos op 11 & 12

Vivaldi Concerto Grosso in C major

Graun Viola da Gamba Concerto in D major
Boieldieu Harp Concerto
Dittersdorf Harp Concerto in A major
Marais La Reveuse
Marais Pieces for Viola da Gamba
Telemann 12 Fantasies for solo violin without bass

Matheis Fantasia in a minor (Alia Fantasia)
Etc
Are you gonna support team trees?
I bet that listening to the pieces will be soothing to the ears
Underrated classical pieces ? sounds like anything made by Vivaldi other than the four seasons.
No one in my school even knows any classical music :(
I soooo agree with Mahler 4th last movement. It makes my heart burst and cry and is so, I am sorry,   heavenly.

Not only enjoyed, I want more! I love when I get the expertise from the real pros…. You could even go farther, telling us what to pay attention to in a certain piece. What would be interesting is a selection per instrument or per period. And it makes me realize how some pieces are not mainstream in the wider public, but probably mainstream to the professional musicians.

There is hundreds of years worth of music. So much that no one could listen to all of it in a life time.
Even the most popular composers wrote prolifically and you'd be hard pressed to listen to all their compositions.
These picks are great and I don't think I've heard any of them. So thanks.
I just can't get into Debussy. His music is too.... colorful it's a bit too much.
I can't take someone whose name sounds so much like cabbage seriously. Kapustin sounds like Kapusta which in Polish and possibly other Slavic languages, which means cabbage.
Simply piano made simply guitar

For the Prokofiev Piano Concerto no.3, you guys maybe could’ve chosen the recordings of Martha Argerich (she has like 100 of them on YouTube probably) ~~ Yuja is phenomenal in her own right without a doubt, but this concerto is almost synonymous with Argerich, and in my opinion she’s the best at bringing out the Prokofiev "taste" as you guys have mentioned 💥

Yes. Loved it. And if you love CD then learn how to pronounce his name. All French Words are stressed in last syllable. All of them.
